title: How Do You Open PHP Files?

steps.title: Download and install Notepad++.
steps.content: Download and install Notepad++. Notepad++ is a free, Windows-only text editor that can open PHP files. To install it, do the following: Go to notepad-plus-plus.org/download/v7.5.8.html in your computer's web browser. Click the green DOWNLOAD button. Double-click the Notepad++ setup file. Follow the installation prompts.

steps.title: Open Notepad++.
steps.content: Open Notepad++. If Notepad++ doesn't automatically open after you finish installing it, open Start , type in notepad++ , and click Notepad++ at the top of the results.

steps.title: Click File.
steps.content: Click File . It's in the top-left corner of the Notepad++ window. A drop-down menu will appear.

steps.title: Click Open….
steps.content: Click Open… . This option is in the drop-down menu. Doing so brings up a File Explorer window.

steps.title: Select your PHP file.
steps.content: Select your PHP file. Go to the location of your PHP file, then click the PHP file to select it.

steps.title: Click Open.
steps.content: Click Open . It's in the bottom-right corner of the window. This will open the PHP file in Notepad++, allowing you to view the file's code and make any necessary edits. If you do edit your PHP file, press Ctrl + S to save the changes before you exit Notepad++.

steps.title: Download and install BBEdit.
steps.content: Download and install BBEdit. This free program allows you to view and edit numerous different file types, PHP included. To install it, do the following: Go to https://www.barebones.com/products/bbedit/ in your Mac's web browser. Click Free Download in the upper-right side of the page. Double-click the downloaded DMG file. Verify the software if prompted. Drag the BBEdit icon onto the "Applications" folder. Follow any on-screen prompts.

steps.title: Open Spotlight .
steps.content: Open Spotlight . Click the magnifying glass-shaped icon in the top-right corner of the screen to do so.

steps.title: Open BBEdit.
steps.content: Open BBEdit. Type in bbedit , then double-click BBEdit in the resulting drop-down menu. If this is your first time opening BBEdit after installing, click Open when prompted, then click Continue to continue with the 30 day trial.

steps.title: Click File.
steps.content: Click File . It's in the top-left corner of the screen. A drop-down menu will appear.

steps.title: Click Open….
steps.content: Click Open… . This is in the File drop-down menu. Doing so opens a Finder window.

steps.title: Select your PHP file.
steps.content: Select your PHP file. Go to the location in which your PHP file is stored, then click the PHP file to select it.

steps.title: Click Open.
steps.content: Click Open . It's in the bottom-right corner of the window. Doing so opens the PHP file in BBEdit; you should now be able to see the PHP file's text. You may instead click Choose here. If you edit your PHP file, be sure to save it by pressing ⌘ Command + S .
